Description: Limestone ostracon: On the recto four incomplete lines of a duplicate text, with red verse points, of the 'Satire of Trades', P. Sallier II 3,9-4,4, followed by an effaced date in red ink. Below this, in the opposite direction, two lines in a different hand of a duplicate text of P. Sallier II 4,3-4, written across vertical lines of an original text in columns (Book of Kemit?). On the verso, in a third hand, six incomplete and faint lines of a duplicate text of the 'Satire of Trades', P. Sallier II 4,2-3.
Curator's comments: For edition of the Teaching of Khety (so-called Satire on Trades): S. Jäger Altägyptische Berufstypologien (Lingua Aegyptia Studia Monographica 4, 2004). Translation : Parkinson, The Tale of Sinuhe and Other Ancient Egyptian Poems 1940–1649 BC. (Oxford World’s Classics 1999), 273-83. Jurijens, J. 2020: The Teaching of Khety Twice – A New Reading of oBM EA 65597 as a School Exercise. In JEA*, 1–8 (https://doi.org/10.1177/0307513319885095).
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393736) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393736)
Exhibition history: 2022-2023 13 Oct-19 Feb, London, BM, Hieroglyphs: unlocking ancient Egypt
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Norman de Garis Davies
